userStories.title: Update install.sh to initialize git submodules
userStories.description:
## Overview
Add submodule initialization to install.sh so vendored skills are pulled automatically when users clone and install Brain Dump.

## Implementation
Add a new step early in the install process:

```bash
init_submodules() {
    print_step "Initializing git submodules"
    
    if [ -f ".gitmodules" ]; then
        if git submodule update --init --recursive; then
            print_success "Git submodules initialized"
            INSTALLED+=("Git submodules")
        else
            print_warning "Could not initialize submodules"
            SKIPPED+=("Git submodules (init failed)")
        fi
    else
        print_info "No submodules configured"
        SKIPPED+=("Git submodules (none configured)")
    fi
}
```

Call this function after the directory check but before dependency installation.

## Why This Matters
- Users get the latest Vercel skills at time of install
- No manual steps required
- Submodule content is fetched on-demand (keeps clone fast)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `init_submodules()` function added to install.sh
- [ ] Function called early in main() flow
- [ ] Handles missing .gitmodules gracefully
- [ ] Success/failure tracked in INSTALLED/SKIPPED arrays

userStories.title: Add setup_claude_skills() function to install.sh
userStories.description:
## Overview
Create a new function in install.sh that copies skills to `~/.claude/skills/` for Claude Code discovery.

## Background
Claude Code discovers skills by scanning `~/.claude/skills/` at startup. Each skill needs:
- A directory named after the skill
- A `SKILL.md` file with YAML frontmatter (name, description)

See: [Claude Code Skills Documentation](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/skills)

## Implementation

```bash
setup_claude_skills() {
    print_step "Setting up Claude Code skills"
    
    CLAUDE_SKILLS_DIR="$HOME/.claude/skills"
    VENDORED_SKILLS="$(pwd)/vendor/agent-skills/skills"
    
    if [ ! -d "$VENDORED_SKILLS" ]; then
        print_warning "Vendored skills not found at $VENDORED_SKILLS"
        print_info "Run: git submodule update --init"
        SKIPPED+=("Claude skills (submodule not initialized)")
        return 0
    fi
    
    mkdir -p "$CLAUDE_SKILLS_DIR"
    
    local skills_installed=0
    local skills_updated=0
    
    for skill_dir in "$VENDORED_SKILLS"/*/; do
        if [ -d "$skill_dir" ] && [ -f "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" ]; then
            local skill_name=$(basename "$skill_dir")
            local target_path="$CLAUDE_SKILLS_DIR/$skill_name"
            
            if [ -d "$target_path" ]; then
                # Update existing
                rm -rf "$target_path"
                cp -r "$skill_dir" "$target_path"
                print_success "  $skill_name (updated)"
                skills_updated=$((skills_updated + 1))
            else
                cp -r "$skill_dir" "$target_path"
                print_success "  $skill_name"
                skills_installed=$((skills_installed + 1))
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    local total=$((skills_installed + skills_updated))
    if [ $total -gt 0 ]; then
        INSTALLED+=("Claude skills ($total)")
        print_info "Skills location: $CLAUDE_SKILLS_DIR"
    else
        SKIPPED+=("Claude skills (none found)")
    fi
}
```

## Integration
- Call this function when `SETUP_CLAUDE=true`
- Add after `install_claude_plugins` in the Claude Code setup section

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Function creates `~/.claude/skills/` if it doesn't exist
- [ ] Copies each skill directory from `vendor/agent-skills/skills/`
- [ ] Only copies directories containing `SKILL.md`
- [ ] Updates existing skills (overwrites)
- [ ] Tracks installed count in summary

userStories.title: Update setup_vscode_skills() to include vendored skills
userStories.description:
## Overview
Modify the existing `setup_vscode_skills()` function to also copy vendored skills from the submodule to `~/.copilot/skills/`.

## Background
VS Code Copilot discovers skills from `~/.copilot/skills/` (global) or `.github/skills/` (workspace).

See: [VS Code Agent Skills Documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/agent-skills)

## Current Behavior
The function currently copies skills from `.github/skills/` to `~/.copilot/skills/`.

## New Behavior
1. Copy skills from `.github/skills/` (Brain Dump's own skills)
2. **Also** copy skills from `vendor/agent-skills/skills/` (Vercel skills)

## Implementation Changes

Add after the existing `.github/skills/` loop:

```bash
# Also install vendored third-party skills
VENDORED_SKILLS="$(pwd)/vendor/agent-skills/skills"

if [ -d "$VENDORED_SKILLS" ]; then
    print_info "Installing vendored skills..."
    
    for skill_dir in "$VENDORED_SKILLS"/*/; do
        if [ -d "$skill_dir" ] && [ -f "$skill_dir/SKILL.md" ]; then
            local skill_name=$(basename "$skill_dir")
            local target_path="$COPILOT_SKILLS_DIR/$skill_name"
            
            if [ -d "$target_path" ]; then
                if ! diff -rq "$skill_dir" "$target_path" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                    rm -rf "$target_path"
                    cp -r "$skill_dir" "$target_path"
                    print_success "  $skill_name (updated)"
                    skills_updated=$((skills_updated + 1))
                else
                    print_info "  $skill_name (exists)"
                fi
            else
                cp -r "$skill_dir" "$target_path"
                print_success "  $skill_name"
                skills_linked=$((skills_linked + 1))
            fi
        fi
    done
fi
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Vendored skills copied alongside Brain Dump's own skills
- [ ] Existing skills from `.github/skills/` still work
- [ ] Update detection works for vendored skills
- [ ] Summary shows total count from both sources

userStories.title: Document skills update mechanism in README
userStories.description:
## Overview
Add documentation explaining:
1. What skills are included with Brain Dump
2. How skills work (discovery, activation)
3. How to update skills to get the latest from Vercel

## Content to Add

### Section: "Included Agent Skills"

```markdown
## Included Agent Skills

Brain Dump includes curated agent skills that provide specialized knowledge to Claude Code and VS Code Copilot:

| Skill | Description | Source |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| react-best-practices | 40+ React/Next.js performance optimization rules | Vercel |
| web-design-guidelines | 100+ accessibility and UX best practices | Vercel |
| brain-dump-tickets | Manage Brain Dump tickets from conversation | Brain Dump |
| ralph-workflow | Ralph autonomous agent workflow | Brain Dump |

### How Skills Work

Skills are discovered automatically by your AI agent:
1. At startup, the agent loads skill names and descriptions (~100 tokens each)
2. When your request matches a skill's keywords, the agent asks to use it
3. Once approved, the full skill instructions load into context

### Updating Skills

To get the latest skill updates from upstream:

```bash
cd brain-dump
git submodule update --remote    # Pull latest from Vercel
./install.sh --claude --vscode   # Re-install to skill directories
```

### Learn More
- [Claude Code Skills](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/skills)
- [VS Code Agent Skills](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/agent-skills)
- [Agent Skills Specification](https://agentskills.io/specification)
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Skills section added to README.md
- [ ] Table lists all included skills with descriptions
- [ ] Update instructions are clear and tested
- [ ] Links to external documentation included

userStories.title: Add --update-skills flag to install.sh
userStories.description:
## Overview
Add a convenience flag to install.sh that updates vendored skills from upstream and re-installs them.

## Usage
```bash
./install.sh --update-skills           # Update skills only
./install.sh --update-skills --claude  # Update and install for Claude
./install.sh --update-skills --vscode  # Update and install for VS Code
```

## Implementation

Add to argument parsing:
```bash
--update-skills)
    UPDATE_SKILLS=true
    ;;
```

Add update function:
```bash
update_vendored_skills() {
    print_step "Updating vendored skills"
    
    if [ ! -f ".gitmodules" ]; then
        print_error "No submodules configured"
        return 1
    fi
    
    print_info "Pulling latest from upstream..."
    if git submodule update --remote --merge; then
        print_success "Skills updated to latest"
        
        # Show what changed
        cd vendor/agent-skills
        local latest_commit=$(git log -1 --format="%h %s")
        print_info "Latest: $latest_commit"
        cd ../..
        
        INSTALLED+=("Skills update")
        return 0
    else
        print_error "Failed to update submodules"
        FAILED+=("Skills update")
        return 1
    fi
}
```

In main():
```bash
if [ "$UPDATE_SKILLS" = true ]; then
    update_vendored_skills || true
fi
```

## Why This Matters
- Single command to update skills
- No need to remember git submodule commands
- Shows what changed after update
- Integrates with existing install flow

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `--update-skills` flag recognized
- [ ] `update_vendored_skills()` function pulls latest
- [ ] Shows latest commit info after update
- [ ] Works standalone or combined with IDE flags
- [ ] Help text updated to document new flag
